intro: Clibadium zakii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, round, yellowish fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated for both horticultural and traditional uses.
